content:
Is this a Proton mail account maybe? I think this is a Proton Mail Bridge thing, not a Thunderbird thing:

https://proton.me/support/what-is-the-recovered-messages-folder-in-bridge
creator: DavidGG

content:
It seems to be a "hiccup" that Proton Bridge automatically generates. The only way to get rid of it is to delete your account from Thunderbird and re-add it.

Thanks!
creator: benjamin.kurata

content: click to the addressbook pane then, click the small icon immediately to the right of the 'new contact' button
creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks David for the tip, it went well.

Truth be told, I was making the process far more complicated.
creator: gneiss2

content: that message occurs when the profiles.ini file is pointing to a profile that does not exist. that doesn't happen if you always copy the thunerbird folder, as that keeps the profiles.ini and profile in sync. my guess is you copied the profile folder. Instead, copy the thunderbird folder from appdata\roaming
creator: davidsk

content:
Your mail is provided by whom? What is the mail server named in your account settings?

This could mean you have a get what you pay for mail provider or there might be a genuine issue. Without the information on what provider it is there is no way to even try and confirm there is an issue.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: look for a file, compatibilities.ini, in the profile folder and delete it. Do this after installing 128.
creator: davidsk

content: In compose window, press the F9 key. that should display the addressbook on left side. If the menu bar is missing, pressing the Alt key should restore it.
creator: davidsk

content: Beide Tasten ergeben keine Veränderung.
creator: bischdi

content: Puzzling. From main screen, if menu bar is not visible, try the alt key or F10. One of those should make it visible. Then, in 'new message' window, the same applies there as well. from the menu bar, click View>Contacts sidebar and then the contacts list should appear. Let me know.
creator: davidsk

content:
Dipende... Se usavi IMAP, tutta la posta dovrebbe essere scaricata di nuovo. Se usavi POP3 non c'è nessun automatismo, devi verificare se la posta è ancora presente sul server di Gmail quindi spostarla nuovamente in Posta in arrivo, marcarla come Non letta e solo dopo provare nuovamente a scaricarla su Thunderbird.

Se invece disponi di un backup, è possibile ripristinare tutto in una decina di minuti.
creator: @next

content:
And when you create a new profile everything works fine? Until it eventually deteriorates again? Try this when the problems appear:

Start Thunderbird in Troubleshoot Mode. The following article explains how to do that and why it can be useful to help identify the cause of a problem:

https://support.mozilla.org/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird

What's your operating system? If Windows, start in Safe Mode with Networking mode:

https://support.microsoft.com/help/12376/windows-10-start-your-pc-in-safe-mode

Does any of that cause the problem to go away?
creator: DavidGG

content:
Anzitutto riporta l'esatto messaggio di errore che ti compare. E poi il maggior numero possibile delle seguenti informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: You have to remove all references to the account from anywhere Thunderbird might still be trying to use it, not just Mail, but also Address Book, Calendar, Chat…

content: What you are seeing is threading. To stop that, highlight the folder, then, on menu bar click view>sort by and tick unthreaded. Do this for all folders. If menu bar is not visible, click the alt key.
creator: davidsk

content: That may have been a typo by someone wanting to reach you. Gmail allows such minor changes to established email accounts. You can create a filter to stop such messages..
creator: davidsk

content:
Reference: https://support.google.com/mail/answer/7436150

Quote: Dots don't matter in Gmail addresses

If someone accidentally adds dots to your address when emailing you, you'll still get that email. For example, if your email is johnsmith@gmail.com, you own all dotted versions of your address:

  • john.smith@gmail.com
  • jo.hn.sm.ith@gmail.com
  • j.o.h.n.s.m.i.t.h@gmail.com
creator: Yu5tiqX9og
